NAME: Crispr Benchling
Description: This site provides a fast CRISPR gRNA designing tool with respect to specified gene or genome coordinates. The result also provide annotation on the exon and CDS information.

NAME: Cas-OFFinder
Description: This tool identifies the possible off-target sites of Cas9 RNA-guided endonucleases.

NAME: CCTop
Description: It's an online tool for CRISPR/Cas9 target prediction. Please go through the paper at doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0124633 for detail.

NAME: Genome Engineering Software Tools
Description: This page of Omictools provide a range of tools related to Crisp Cas, viz. pgRNADesign, MAGESTIC, ProtospacerWB etc.

NAME: CHOPCHOP v.2
Description: "CHOPCHOP is a web tool for selecting target sites for CRISPR/Cas9, CRISPR/Cpf1 or TALEN-directed mutagenesis". Please refer to doi:10.1093/nar/gkw398

NAME: CRISPOR
Description: This tool is used for designing, evaluating and cloning guide sequences for the CRISPR/Cas9 system.

NAME: CRISPR LifePipe
Description: To "design both gRNA and donor template sequences required for genome editing".

NAME: sgRNA Designer
Description: "This tool ranks and picks candidate sgRNA sequences for the targets provided, while attempting to maximize on-target activity and minimizing off-target activity"

NAME: DESKGEN
Description: This fully user customezable biocomputational tool-set is provided by Desktop Genetics group.

NAME: CRISPR-Cas9 (CRISPR-associated protein 9)
Description: The foundational CRISPR-Cas9 system is a powerful tool for genome editing in a wide range of organisms.

NAME: CRISPR-Cas12 (Cpf1)
Description: CRISPR-Cas12, or Cpf1, is another genome editing system with distinct properties from Cas9.

NAME: CRISPR-CasX:
Description: CasX is a recently discovered Cas protein with potential applications in genome editing

NAME: CRISPR-CasY:
Description: CasY is another recently identified Cas protein with genome editing potential

NAME: CRISPR-Cas3
Description: Cas3 is used for DNA degradation and may have applications in genome engineering

NAME: CRISPR-Cas14
Description: Cas14 is a compact system for genome editing and nucleic acid detection.

NAME: CRISPR-CasPhi:
Description: CasPhi is a giant CRISPR-Cas system found in bacteriophages and has applications in genome editing.

NAME: CRISPR-Cas Transposase:
Description: This system utilizes a transposase for precise genome integration and editing

NAME: CRISPR-Cas9 Nickase (D10A):
Description: Cas9 nickases introduce single-strand breaks instead of double-strand breaks, reducing off-target effects

NAME: Prime Editing:
Description: Prime editing is a newer, highly precise genome editing technique.

NAME: CRISPR-Cas9 Base Editors
Description: Base editors allow the direct conversion of one DNA base to another without causing double-strand breaks.

NAME: CRISPR-Cas9 Delivery Systems:
Description: Various delivery systems are available to efficiently introduce CRISPR components into cells or organisms

NAME: Synthetic Guide RNA (sgRNA) Design Tools:
Description: Tools for designing custom sgRNAs to target specific genomic regions.

NAME: CRISPR-Cas9 Libraries:
Description: Libraries of pre-designed sgRNAs for genome-wide screening and functional analysis

NAME: CRISPR Visualization Tools
Description: Tools for visualizing CRISPR experimental results and genomic changes.

NAME: CRISPR-Cas9 Safety and Ethics Resources:
Description: Resources and guidelines for safe and ethical use of CRISPR technologies.

NAME: The Broad Institute - CRISPR-Cas9 Resources:
Description: he Broad Institute provides extensive resources, protocols, and information on CRISPR-Cas9 technology.

NAME: UC Berkeley Innovative Genomics Institute:
Description: This institute offers tools, resources, and research updates related to CRISPR technology.

NAME: CRISPRweb
Description: CRISPRweb is a portal for information and resources on CRISPR technology, including tools for designing sgRNAs

NAME: CRISPR Therapeutics:
Description: CRISPR Therapeutics is a biopharmaceutical company focused on developing CRISPR-based therapies.

NAME: Editas Medicine
Description: Editas Medicine is a leading genome editing company that applies CRISPR technology for therapeutic purposes.

NAME: Addgene - CRISPR Resources
Description: Addgene offers a comprehensive collection of CRISPR plasmids and resources for genome editing research.

NAME: GEN CRISPR Gene Editing Hub
Description: GEN's hub provides articles, news, and resources related to CRISPR-Cas9 gene editing

NAME: EMBO CRISPR-Cas Course
Description: The European Molecular Biology Organization offers a CRISPR-Cas course covering the fundamentals and applications.

NAME: MEGAN4-MEtaGenome ANalyzer
Description: It is a "stand-alone analysis tool for metagenomic of short-read data".

NAME: MG-RAST
Description: "MG-RAST (the Metagenomics RAST) server is an automated analysis platform for metagenomes providing quantitative insights into microbial populations based on sequence data". Its works the best in Firefox browser.

NAME: IMG/M
Description: The Integrated Microbial Genomes (IMG) system serves as a community resource for analysis and annotation of genome and metagenome datasets in a comprehensive comparative context. The IMG data warehouse integrates genome and metagenome datasets provided by IMG users with a comprehensive set of publicly available isolate and single cell genomes, and a rich set of publicly available metagenome samples.

NAME: CAMERA
Description: CAMERA (Community Cyberinfrastructure for Advanced Microbial Ecology Research and Analysis) aims at serving the" needs of the microbial ecology research community, and other scientists using metagenomics data, by creating a rich, distinctive data repository and a bioinformatics tools resource that will address many of the unique challenges of metagenomic analysis".

NAME: CARMA
Description: "CARMA is a software pipeline for characterizing the taxonomic composition and genetic diversity of short-read metagenomes. The software was originally designed for the analysis of environmental metagenomes obtained by the ultra-fast 454 pyrosequencing system".

NAME: Terragenome
Description: Its an international soil metagenome sequencing consortium.

NAME: QIIME
Description: QIIME (Quantitative Insights Into Microbial Ecology) is a widely used bioinformatics pipeline for microbial community analysis

NAME: Mothur
Description: Mothur is a comprehensive software package for analyzing 16S rRNA gene sequences for microbial ecology studies.

NAME: MetaPhlAn
Description: MetaPhlAn is a tool for profiling the composition of microbial communities using metagenomic shotgun sequencing data.

NAME: Kraken
Description: Kraken is a taxonomic sequence classifier that can rapidly analyze metagenomic data to assign taxonomic labels

NAME: MetaBAT
Description: MetaBAT is a tool for metagenomic binning, which groups contigs into genome bins for individual microorganisms.

NAME: MaxBin
Description: MaxBin is another metagenomic binning tool designed to recover high-quality genomes from complex microbial communities

NAME: MG-RAST
Description: MG-RAST (Metagenomics Rapid Annotation using Subsystem Technology) is a web-based platform for metagenomic analysis and annotation.

NAME: MetaGeneMark
Description: MetaGeneMark is a tool for predicting genes in metagenomic sequences and annotating their functions

NAME: CAMERA
Description: CAMERA (Community Cyberinfrastructure for Advanced Microbial Ecology Research and Analysis) is a data repository and analysis platform for metagenomic and environmental data.

NAME: MetaVelvet
Description: MetaVelvet is a metagenome assembler, which can assemble metagenomic sequencing data into contigs and scaffolds.

NAME: MetaPhlAn2
Description: An improved version of MetaPhlAn, MetaPhlAn2 provides even more accurate taxonomic profiling of metagenomic data.

NAME: Anvi'o
Description: Anvi'o is an analysis and visualization platform designed for metagenomics and microbial ecology studies.

NAME: DIAMOND
Description: DIAMOND is a fast and sensitive tool for aligning metagenomic sequencing reads to protein databases for functional analysis.

NAME: HUMAnN
Description: HUMAnN (HMP Unified Metabolic Analysis Network) is a tool for characterizing microbial metabolic pathways from metagenomic data.

NAME: MetaPhyler
Description: MetaPhyler is a tool for taxonomic profiling of metagenomic data based on k-mer frequencies.

NAME: CONCOCT
Description: CONCOCT is a metagenomic binning tool that uses a combination of sequence composition and coverage to group contigs.

NAME: MetaStorm
Description: MetaStorm is a metagenomic analysis and visualization platform that includes tools for taxonomy, functional analysis, and more.

NAME: METAGENassist
Description: METAGENassist is a web-based tool for metagenomic data analysis and visualization, offering various modules for different tasks.

NAME: MetaPhinder
Description: MetaPhinder is a tool for identifying phage sequences in metagenomic data, helping to characterize viral communities.

NAME: MetaPathways
Description: MetaPathways is a modular pipeline for functional annotation of metagenomic sequences, including the reconstruction of metabolic pathways.

NAME: MetaCompass
Description: MetaCompass is a metagenomic assembly and analysis tool designed to handle complex microbial communities.

NAME: MetaGOmics
Description: MetaGOmics is a comprehensive metagenomics analysis platform that integrates functional, taxonomic, and statistical analysis tools.

NAME: STRAND NGS
Description: offers many different tools including alignment, RNA-Seq, DNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq, Small RNA-Seq, Genome Browser, visualizations, Biological Interpretation, etc. Supports workflows one can import the sample data in FASTA, FASTQ or tag-count format. In addition, prealigned data in SAM, BAM or Illumina-specific ELAND format can be directly imported for analysis

NAME: CGL GENOMICS INCLUDE
Description: (QIAGEN). Features include: resequencing, workflow, read mapping, de novo assembly, variant detection, RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq, Genome Browser, etc (entire list on website); Main Workbench offers database search (Genbank, Blast, Pubmed); 2000 organizations have invested in CLC

NAME: DNAnexus
Description: Private cloud repository -- formerly a redistributor of SRA and other NCBI resources; command-line or via web, can fetch data from a URL, build custom pipeline/ workflow has sra.dnanexus.com site: data downloads come directly from NCBI

NAME: ingenuint varaiant analysis
Description: (QIAGEN) allows for variant identification and analysis, uses NCI-60 data set for cancer, Supported third part informatin: Entrez Gene, RefSeq, ClinVar; gives contextual details of results instead of just A to B relationship

NAME: Laser gene genomic suite
Description: Supported workflows include: reference-guided and de novo genome and transcriptome assembly and analysis, metagenomics sample assembly, targeted resequencing, exome alignment, gene panels with validation control, variant analysis, and RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq and miRNA alignment and analysis.

NAME: NextGne
Description: perfect analytical partner for the analysis of desktop sequencing data produced by the ION PGM, Roche Junior, Illumina MiSeq as well as high throughput systems as the Ion Torrent Proton, Roche FLX, Applied BioSystems SOLiD and Illumina® platforms. runs on Windows, free-standing multi-application package-- SNP/Indel analysis, CNV prediction and disease discovery, whole genome alignment, etc.

NAME: Partek genomics site
Description: Workflows for microarray and PCR data include: Gene expression including alternative splicing, miRNA expression,  Next Generation Sequencing (NGS) workflows include: RNA-Seq, miRNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq, DNA-Seq, and Methylation

NAME: partek flow
Description: Performs base trimming, alignment, quantification, quality analysis, statistics, and visualization

NAME: Golden helix
Description: used for managing, analyzing and visualizing genotypic and phenotypic data; Features: Genome-wide association studies, genomic prediction, copy number analysis, small sample DNA-Seq workflows, large sample DNA-seq

NAME: Genomatics
Description: Applications: ChIP-Seq, DNA-Seq, RNA-Seq, DNA methylation; enable personalized medicine,

NAME: Biodtomics
Description: Open source platform (SaaS), analysis and genome sequencing tools, integrates over 400 genomic analysis open source tools and pipelines, have a private and public cloud version

NAME: Solvebio
Description: Software product, for clinical genomics professionals, manage, curate, report genomic variation

NAME: Basepair
Description: Offers high quality workflows for all common NGS applications (RNA-Seq, ChIP-Seq, DNA-Seq, etc.)

NAME: IMPUTE2
Description: phasing observed genotypes and imputing missing genotypes uses reference panels to provide all available halotypes, does not use population labels

NAME: FREEBAYES
Description: finds SNPs, Indels, MNPs; reports variants based on alignment

NAME: SOAPindel
Description: detects indels from NGS paired-end sequencing

NAME: 2Kplus2
Description: algorithm searches graphs produced by de novo assembler Cortex; c++ source code for SNP

NAME: Atlas 2
Description: specializes in separation of true SNPs and indels from sequencing and mapping errors

NAME: CRISP
Description: identifies SNPs and INDELs from pooled high-throughput NGS, not used for analysis of single samples

NAME: Dindel
Description: (Wellcome Trust Sanger) calls small indels from short-read sequences, only can handle Illumina data; cannot test candidate indels

NAME: Discosnp++
Description: detects homozygous and heterozygous SNPs and Indels

NAME: FAM sequencing
Description: family-based sequencing studies- provides probability of an individual carrying variant based on familys raw measurements;

NAME: Genetic Thesaurus
Description: Annotation of genetic variants in repetitive regions

NAME: GLF multiple
Description: command-line, variant caller

NAME: GLF single
Description: uses likelihood-based model for variant calling, starts from genotype likelihoods that have been computed from other tools

NAME: Halvade
Description: command-line; written in Java, to run halvade a reference is needed for both GATK and BWA and a SNP (dbSNP!) database is required

NAME: Indel miner
Description: identifies indels from paired-end reads

NAME: Indel locator
Description: does not perform realignment, relies on alignments in BAM files (BAM files need aligned before put into indelocator); recommended to use GATK prior;

NAME: Isaac variant caller
Description: detects SNPs and small indels from diploid sample; designed to run on nux-like platforms

NAME: Kvarq
Description: in silico genotyping for selected loci in bacterial genome,

NAME: Lo Freq
Description: SNV caller, Python language, standalone program, uncovers cell-population heterogeneity from high-throughput sequencing datasets

NAME: Manta
Description: Calls indels and SVs from paired end reads; standalone, command line program; Written in C++ and Python

NAME: Margin Align
Description: SNV caller, specifically tailored to Oxford Nanopore Reads, written in Python; Package comes with 3 programs, marginAlign

NAME: Mendel scan
Description: for analyzing sequencing data in family studies of inherited diseases

NAME: Nanopore
Description: (group at UCSC studying using ion channels for analysis of single RNA/DNA structures) software pipeline; tailored to Oxford Nanopore Reads; command line program

NAME: SNPg
Description: can be used as a standalone application with graphical user interface as part of pipeline system

NAME: REVIster
Description: command line program; automated pipeline; utilizes BWA, BLAT, and SAMTools; utilizes BWA mapping program;

NAME: RVD
Description: command-line program, detection of rare SNVs, relies upon Samtools

NAME: SNVer
Description: calls common and rare variants in pool or individual NGS data, reports overall p-value, operating system independent statistical tool

NAME: SNV Mix
Description: detects SNVs from NGS

NAME: SVM
Description: Structural Variant Machine - predicts indels, uses split read alignment profiles, validated by Sanger Sequencng

NAME: SNPest
Description: Standalone program, language C++, Perl

NAME: TRIOcaller
Description: Command line program, relies on BWA and samtools; genotype calling for unrelated individuals and parent-offspring trios

NAME: SNIPPY
Description: finds indels between haploid reference genome and NGS sequence reads

NAME: VNTE seek
Description: pipeline for discovering microsatellite tandem repeats with high-throughput sequencing data

NAME: CAKE
Description: standalone program, pipeline for the integrated analysis of somatic variants in cancer genomes; integrates four algorithms

NAME: MuTect
Description: Broad Institute, identification of somatic point mutations in cancer genomes; requires preprocessing of reads (GATK)

NAME: Polymut
Description: calls SNVs and detects de novo point mutations in families

NAME: Basovacc
Description: Improved Bayesian inversion somatic caller; unlike other software packages, treats effects fully probabilisticallys instead of using ad-hoc modeling;

NAME: CLImat
Description: standalone program; accurate detection of copy number alteration and loss of heterozygosity in impure and aneuploid tumor samples using whole genome sequencing data

NAME: DE NOVO
Description: de-novo variant calling and interpretation; standalone program; dependencies C++ compiler, CMake, HTSlib, Eigen, Boost

NAME: EB Call
Description: Empirical Baysian Mutation Calling; standalone program; uses tumor/normal paired reads and non-paired normal reference samples

NAME: HAPMUC
Description: utilizes the information of heterozygous germline variants near candidate mutations; Dependent upon- Boost, SAMtools, BEDtools;

NAME: MULTIGEMS
Description: Multi-sample Genotype Model Selection

NAME: MULTI SNV
Description: command-line program; calls SNVs from NGS data from multiple samples from the same patient; dependent on R, Git, cmake, Boost and compile libraries

NAME: MUTATION SEQ
Description: standalone program, somatic SNV detection in tumor/normal samples; dependent on python, bamtools, boost, and LAPACK

NAME: QSNP
Description: standalone program; SNV caller for somatic variants in low cellularity cancer samples

NAME: RADIA
Description: RNA and DNA Integrated Analysis for Somatic Mutation Detection; DNA only Method(tumor/normal pair, ignores RNA)

NAME: RVD2
Description: sensitive, variant detection for low-depth targeted NGS data; python module or command- line program;

NAME: SHIMMER
Description: standalone program; detects somatic SNVs with multiple testing correction, uses Fishers exact test;

NAME: SNVPPL
Description: Refines GATKs Unified Genotyper SNV calls for multiple samples assumed to form a phylogeny

NAME: SOMATIC SNIPER
Description: command-line application to identify SNPs between tumor/normal pairs- predicts probability of difference between two

NAME: STRELKA
Description: somatic variant calling workflow for matched tumor-normal samples; detects indels; runs on *nux-like platform

NAME: TRIODENOVO
Description: Bayesian framework for calling de novo mutations in trios

NAME: UNCeqr
Description: finds somatic mutations using integration of DNA and RNA seq data-- boosts sensitivity for low purity tumors and rare mutations;

NAME: Virmid
Description: Virtual Microdissection for SNP calling; Java based; for disease-control matched samples; uncovers SNPs with low allele frequency by considering alpha contamination

NAME: Varscan
Description: identify germline variants, private and shared variants, somatic mutations, and somatic CNVs; detects indels

NAME: BAYSIC
Description: ayesian method; combines variant calls from different methods (GATK, FreeBayes, Atlas, Samtools,

NAME: MSIsensor
Description: Microsatellite instability detection; C++ program, detects somatic and germline variants in tumor-normal paired data

NAME: BEAGLE
Description: software package: genotype calling, phasing, imputation of ungenotyped markers, and identity-by-descent segment detection:unsure if this one is in the right category; genotype calling, phasing, imputation of ungenotyped markers, and identity-by-descent segment detection;

NAME: QUADGT
Description: software package, SNV calling from normal-tumor pair and two parent genomes; quantifies descent-by-modification relationships

NAME: RAREVATOR
Description: RAre REference VAriant annotaTOR; command line; identification and annotation of germline and somatic variants in rare reference allele loci from second generation sequencing data; Bayesian genotype likelihood model

NAME: SCALPEL
Description: Used for detecting indels in a reference genome; performs localized micro-assembly of specific regions of interest; can do single, de novo, somatic reads; requires that raw reads are aligned with BWA

NAME: SOAPSNP
Description: based on Bayes theorem; calls consensus genotype

NAME: VARIANT MASTER
Description: extract causative variants for monogenic and sporadic genetic diseases

NAME: Myrna
Description: "Myrna is a cloud computing tool for calculating differential gene expression in large RNA-seq datasets. Myrna uses Bowtie for short read alignment and R/Bioconductor for interval calculations, normalization, and statistical testing. These tools are combined in an automatic, parallel pipeline that runs in the cloud (Elastic MapReduce in this case) on a local Hadoop cluster, or on a single computer, exploiting multiple computers and CPUs wherever possible"

NAME: Cufflinks
Description: "Cufflinks assembles transcripts, estimates their abundances, and tests for differential expression and regulation in RNA-Seq samples. It accepts aligned RNA-Seq reads and assembles the alignments into a parsimonious set of transcripts. Cufflinks then estimates the relative abundances of these transcripts based on how many reads support each one, taking into account biases in library preparation protocols"

NAME: Rnnotator
Description: "Rnnotator" software: To address challenges related to comprehensive annotation and quantification of transcriptomes, Rnnotator was developed by a team at the JGI to provide an automated software pipeline that generates transcript models by de novo assembly of RNA-Seq data without the need for a reference genome"

NAME: Genomic Short-read Nucleotide Alignment Program (GSNAP)
Description: Used for aligning short reads of transcripts. It has added feature of enbling the user to check "for and eliminating indel/splice combinations at ends of alignments", "finding of microexons in short reads"

NAME: TopHat
Description: "TopHat is a fast splice junction mapper for RNA-Seq reads. It aligns RNA-Seq reads to mammalian-sized genomes using the ultra high-throughput short read aligner Bowtie, and then analyzes the mapping results to identify splice junctions between exons"

NAME: Trinity
Description: Trinity "represents a novel method for the efficient and robust de novo reconstruction of transcriptomes from RNA-seq data. Trinity combines three independent software modules: Inchworm, Chrysalis, and Butterfly, applied sequentially to process large volumes of RNA-seq reads"

NAME: ERANGE
Description: "E-RANGE is our Python package for doing RNA-seq and ChIP-seq (hence the "dual-use"), and is a descendant of the ChIPSeq mini peak finder ". "ERANGE is not compatible with bowtie 0.9.9.X"

NAME: Trans-Abyss
Description: "Trans-ABySS is a software package that is designed to analyze ABySS-assembled whole-genome shotgun transcriptome data"

NAME: Scripture
Description: "Scripture is a method for transcriptome reconstruction that relies solely on RNA-Seq reads and an assembled genome to build a transcriptome ab initio."

NAME: RUM
Description: "RUM is an RNA-Seq alignment pipeline"

NAME: G-Mo.R-Se
Description: G-Mo.R-Se is a method aimed at using RNA-Seq short reads to build de novo gene models. The "candidate exons are built directly from the positions of the reads mapped on the genome (without any ab initio assembly of the reads), and all the possible splice junctions between those exons are tested against unmapped reads : the testing of junctions is directed by the information available in the RNA-Seq dataset rather than a priori knowledge about the genome. Exons can thus be chained into stranded gene models"

NAME: MapSplice
Description: It is used for "accurate mapping of RNA-seq reads for splice junction discovery".

NAME: SpliceMap
Description: "SpliceMap is a de novo splice junction discovery and alignment tool. It offers high sensitivity and support for arbitrary RNA-seq read lengths"

NAME: Oases
Description: It is used for "De novo transcriptome assembler for very short reads". "Oases is a de novo transcriptome assembler designed to produce transcripts from short read sequencing technologies, such as Illumina, SOLiD, or 454 in the absence of any genomic assembly. Oases is a de novo transcriptome assembler designed to produce transcripts from short read sequencing technologies, such as Illumina, SOLiD, or 454 in the absence of any genomic assembly"

NAME: ANNOVAR
Description: ANNOVAR is a tool for annotating genetic variants detected in high-throughput sequencing data. It provides information on the functional consequences of variants, such as their effects on protein coding, splicing, and regulatory regions. ANNOVAR supports multiple types of annotation databases, making it a versatile tool for variant analysis.

NAME: OMIM (Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man):
Description: OMIM is a comprehensive, authoritative database of human genes and genetic disorders. It provides detailed information on the relationship between gene mutations and phenotypic expression, including descriptions of genetic disorders, associated genes, and references to scientific literature.

NAME: GoldenGate (Illumina)
Description: GoldenGate is a genotyping assay technology developed by Illumina that uses bead-based microarrays to genotype multiple single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) simultaneously. It is known for its accuracy, high throughput, and flexibility in customizing SNP panels for various research purposes.

NAME: TaqMan (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
Description: TaqMan is a technology for quantitative PCR (qPCR) and genotyping assays developed by Thermo Fisher Scientific. It uses fluorescent probes to detect and quantify specific DNA sequences, providing highly accurate and sensitive measurements of gene expression and genetic variants.

NAME: WGSA (Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis) pipelines
Description: WGSA pipelines are comprehensive analysis workflows designed to process and interpret whole genome sequencing (WGS) data. They typically include steps for data quality control, alignment, variant calling, annotation, and interpretation, enabling researchers to derive meaningful insights from WGS datasets.

NAME: ChIP-seq analysis tools
Description: ChIP-seq (Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Sequencing) analysis tools are used to analyze data from experiments that combine chromatin immunoprecipitation with next-generation sequencing. These tools help identify DNA binding sites of transcription factors and other proteins, map histone modifications, and analyze chromatin structure. Common tools include MACS (Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq) for peak calling and HOMER (Hypergeometric Optimization of Motif EnRichment) for motif discovery.

NAME: ClinVar
Description: ClinVar is a freely accessible database maintained by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) that aggregates information about genomic variations and their relationship to human health. It provides clinical annotations, including pathogenicity, clinical significance, and supporting evidence for various genetic variants.

NAME: gnoMAD (Genome Aggregation Database)
Description: gnomAD is a resource that aggregates and harmonizes exome and genome sequencing data from a wide range of large-scale sequencing projects. It provides allele frequencies for millions of genetic variants across diverse populations, helping researchers understand genetic diversity and identify rare variants associated with diseases.

NAME: UCSC Genome Browser
Description: The UCSC Genome Browser is an online tool for visualizing and analyzing genomic data. It provides a graphical interface to browse various genomes, access integrated annotations, and retrieve sequence data. Users can explore gene structures, regulatory elements, comparative genomics, and much more.

NAME: Ensembl Genome Browser
Description: The Ensembl Genome Browser is a platform for accessing and visualizing genomic data for various species. It provides comprehensive annotations, including gene models, variation data, comparative genomics, and regulatory features. Ensembl supports integration with various external data sources and tools, facilitating in-depth genomicÂ research.

NAME: PLINK
Description: PLINK is a widely used open-source software tool for genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and population-based linkage analysis. It provides functions for data management, statistical analysis of genotype/phenotype data, and the calculation of various genetic metrics, such as linkage disequilibrium, haplotype blocks, and principal components.

NAME: GCTA (Genome-wide Complex Trait Analysis)
Description: GCTA is a software tool for analyzing the genetic architecture of complex traits. It can estimate the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by genome-wide SNPs, perform genomic prediction, and conduct GWAS meta-analysis. GCTA is designed to handle large-scale genetic data and to study the genetic basis of complex traits.

NAME: MACH (MACH Admixture and Coalescence Hidden Markov model
Description: MACH is a software tool for haplotype estimation and genotype imputation. It uses a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) to infer missing genotypes and phase haplotypes based on known haplotype reference panels. MACH is commonly used in genetic studies to improve the accuracy of genotype data.

NAME: Impute2
Description: Impute2 is a genotype imputation software tool that uses reference haplotype panels to infer missing genotypes in genome-wide association studies (GWAS). It employs a hidden Markov model to predict genotypes, increasing the power of GWAS by providing a more complete and accurate dataset.

NAME: Illumina Infinium Global Screening Array
Description: The Illumina Infinium Global Screening Array is a high-density SNP genotyping array designed for population genomics and genetic research. It includes a diverse set of markers optimized for genetic diversity studies, clinical research, and pharmacogenomics applications.

NAME: Axiom Genotyping Solution (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
Description: The Axiom Genotyping Solution is a high-throughput genotyping platform offered by Thermo Fisher Scientific. It includes customizable microarrays for SNP and indel genotyping, enabling researchers to study genetic variation in various populations and species.

NAME: UK Biobank
Description: The UK Biobank is a large-scale biomedical database and research resource containing genetic, health, and lifestyle information from half a million UK participants. It provides extensive data for studying the determinants of complex diseases and traits, facilitating research in genetics, epidemiology, and public health.

NAME: STITCH (Systematic Tool for Interactions between Chemicals and Targets)
Description: STITCH is a database and tool for exploring interactions between chemicals and proteins. It integrates information from multiple sources to predict and visualize potential interactions, aiding in the study of drug mechanisms, toxicology, and chemical biology.

NAME: GWAS Catalog
Description: The GWAS Catalog is a publicly accessible database of published genome-wide association studies (GWAS). It curates and provides information on SNP-trait associations from numerous studies, enabling researchers to explore genetic variants linked to various traits and diseases.

NAME: NHGRI GWAS Catalog
Description: The NHGRI GWAS Catalog, maintained by the National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI), is a comprehensive resource that collects and curates data from GWAS studies. It includes information on SNP-trait associations, study details, and relevant publications

NAME: FRAPPE (Fast Random Association with Partner Pool Estimation)
Description: FRAPPE is a software tool for estimating individual ancestry proportions from genotype data. It uses a model-based approach similar to ADMIXTURE and STRUCTURE, providing fast and accurate ancestry inference for population genetics studies.

NAME: SAIGE (Sequence Association and Interaction Gene Set Enrichment)
Description: SAIGE is a statistical tool for genetic association studies, particularly designed to handle unbalanced case-control data and large sample sizes. It uses mixed models to account for relatedness and population structure, improving the power and accuracy of rare variant association tests.

NAME: WASP (Whole Genome Annotation System for Personalized Medicine)
Description: WASP is a comprehensive system for annotating and interpreting whole-genome sequencing data. It integrates various annotation tools and databases to provide functional insights into genetic variants, supporting personalized medicine and clinical genomics.

NAME: FUMA (Functional Mapping and Annotation of Genome-Wide Association Studies)
Description: FUMA is an online platform for annotating, prioritizing, and interpreting GWAS results. It integrates various functional annotation databases and tools to provide insights into the biological mechanisms underlying genetic associations and to prioritize candidate genes and variants for further study.

NAME: LDlink (Linkage Disequilibrium analysis)
Description: LDlink is a suite of web-based tools for exploring linkage disequilibrium (LD) and related genomic features. It provides interactive visualization and analysis of LD patterns, haplotype structures, and variant annotations using data from large population studies like 1000 Genomes.

NAME: POSSEQ (Polygenic Scores for Sequencing Data)
Description: POSSEQ is a tool for calculating polygenic risk scores (PRS) from sequencing data. It aggregates the effects of multiple genetic variants to estimate an individual's genetic predisposition to certain traits or diseases, aiding in the study of complex genetic architectures.

NAME: REVEL (Rare Variant Explanatory Lever)
Description: REVEL is a computational tool for predicting the pathogenicity of rare missense variants. It integrates scores from multiple prediction tools and databases to provide a consensus assessment, helping researchers and clinicians prioritize variants for further study and potential clinicalÂ relevance.

NAME: qPCR Analysis Tool
Description: Improve your qPCR data analysis and interpretation. Simply input qPCR data and the tool will perform statistical analyses, assist with data interpretation, and provide visual representation of the data.

NAME: hPSC Genetic Analysis Tool
Description: When used with the hPSC Genetic Analysis Kit, this tool enables rapid detection of abnormalities within human pluripotent stem cell cultures.

NAME: L-Calc? Software
Description: Streamline how you analyze the results of your limiting dilution analyses in your colony forming assays.

NAME: PASTAA
Description: The PASTAA program predicts Transcription Factors (TFs) regulating a user defined set of genes.

NAME: Homer
Description: HOMER was primarily written as a de novo motif discovery algorithm and is well suited for finding 8-20 bp motifs in large scale genomics data.

NAME: GeoSTAN
Description: GeoStan uses data from two primary sources to perform its functions: a street network database, acquired from one of several premium vendors or the U.S. Census

NAME: iRegulon
Description: iRegulon detects the master regulons and co-factors from a set of differentially expressed genes.

NAME: CAGE
Description: Cap Analysis of Gene Expression (CAGE) is a method for promoter identification and transcription profiling developed by RIKEN

NAME: karyotyping
Description: examination of cellular chromosome number and morphology. Differences in appearance include size, position of centromeres, and changes in banding patterns.

NAME: single-nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) analysis
Description: SNP arrays are used for detecting loss of heterozygosity (LOH).

NAME: epigenetic profiling
Description: A stem cell's pluripotency is dictated to a large extent by its epigenetic profile

NAME: flow cytometry
Description: Fluorescently tagged monoclonal antibodies can be used to distinguish specific cell populations, and cell sorting can be used to physically separate different stem cell populations.

NAME: immunocytochemistry
Description: Immunocytochemistry is predominantly used to confirm the presence or absence of protein expression in stem cells.

NAME: digital PCR,
Description: RT-digital PCR provide rapid, sensitive, and quantitative methods for monitoring the gene expression profile of any cell population

NAME: western blotting
Description: In studying the mechanism of stem cell differentiation, western blotting is useful for determining the success of transfection experiments. When a gene is either introduced into the cell or knocked down using antisense RNA or RNAi molecules, detection and quantitation of the presence and level of protein expression by western blotting is often coupled with measurements of transcript levels by RT-qPCR. Importantly, western blots can be used to study the effects of transfection on downstream protein expression.

NAME: biomarker analysis
Description: Regulation of biological processes can be controlled by protein interactions, relative protein levels, and posttranslational protein modification

NAME: teratoma formation
Description: teratoma formation can be used as indicators of stemness when analyzing the pluripotency of stem cells

NAME: R/Bioconductor
Description: Bioconductor is a collection of R packages specifically designed for analyzing genomic data, including stem cell-related data. It provides a wide range of tools and algorithms for data preprocessing, visualization, differential expression analysis, and more.

NAME: MATLAB
Description: programming language and environment widely used in scientific research, including stem cell research. It offers a rich set of functions and toolboxes for data analysis, statistical modeling, image processing, and machine learning.

NAME: FlowJo
Description: FlowJo is a powerful software package specifically designed for flow cytometry data analysis, a technique commonly used in stem cell research. It provides tools for data visualization, gating, and statistical analysis of flow cytometry data

NAME: Ingenuity Pathway Analysis (IPA)
Description: IPA is a web-based tool that helps in the interpretation of omics data, including gene expression data from stem cells. It provides comprehensive pathway analysis, network analysis, and functional annotation to gain insights into the biological processes and molecular interactions involved in stem cell function.

NAME: Cytoscape
Description: Cytoscape is an open-source software platform for visualizing and analyzing molecular interaction networks. It can be used to analyze gene regulatory networks and protein-protein interaction networks in stem cell research.

NAME: GeneSpring
Description: GeneSpring is a software suite developed by Agilent Technologies for microarray and RNA-seq data analysis.

NAME: DESeq2
Description: DESeq2 is a statistical tool that allows researchers to identify differentially expressed genes from RNA-Seq data. It takes into account the inherent variability in the sequencing data and corrects for it, providing more accurate results.

NAME: Seurat
Description: Seurat is an R package designed for QC, analysis, and exploration of single-cell RNA-seq data.

NAME: Monocle
Description: Monocle introduced the strategy of ordering single cells in pseudotime, placing them along a trajectory corresponding to a biological process such as cell differentiation by taking advantage of individual cell's asynchronous progression of those processes.

NAME: Scanpy
Description: Scanpy is a scalable toolkit for analyzing single-cell gene expression data built jointly with anndata. It includes preprocessing, visualization, clustering, trajectory inference and differential expression testing.

NAME: Cell Ranger
Description: Cell Ranger is a set of analysis pipelines that process Chromium single cell data to align reads, generate feature-barcode matrices, perform clustering and other secondary analysis

NAME: DAVID (Database for Annotation, Visualization, and Integrated Discovery)
Description: The Database for Annotation, Visualization and Integrated Discovery (DAVID) provides a comprehensive set of functional annotation tools for investigators to understand the biological meaning behind large lists of genes.

NAME: clusterProfiler
Description: The clusterProfiler package is a versatile tool for enrichment analysis.

NAME: TIBCO Spotfire
Description: Tibco Spotfire, developed by Tibco Software, is a program used for advanced analytics and data visualisation. Spotfire provides a comprehensive suite of data analysis capabilities, such as advanced analytics, predictive modeling, data visualisation and preparation.

NAME: GraphPad Prism
Description: GraphPad Prism combines scientific graphing, comprehensive curve fitting (nonlinear regression), understandable statistics, and data organization. While it won't replace a heavy-duty statistics program, Prism lets you easily perform basic statistical tests commonly used by laboratory and clinical researchers.

NAME: Partek Genomics Suite
Description: Partek Genomics Suite is a statistical analysis software that lets you analyze microarray, qPCR, and pre-processed NGS data right from your desktop computer. It is fast, agile, and memory efficient.

NAME: GenePattern
Description: GenePattern provides hundreds of analytical tools for the analysis of gene expression (RNA-seq and microarray), sequence variation and copy number, proteomic, flow cytometry, and network analysis. These tools are all available through a Web interface with no programming experience required.

NAME: Qlucore Omics Explorer
Description: Qlucore Omics Explorer is a Do-It-Yourself bioinformatics software for research in the life science, biotech, food and plant industries, as well as academia

NAME: ANNOVAR
Description: ANNOVAR is a tool for annotating genetic variants detected in high-throughput sequencing data. It provides information on the functional consequences of variants, such as their effects on protein coding, splicing, and regulatory regions. ANNOVAR supports multiple types of annotation databases, making it a versatile tool for variant analysis.

NAME: OMIM (Online Mendelian Inheritance in Man):
Description: OMIM is a comprehensive, authoritative database of human genes and genetic disorders. It provides detailed information on the relationship between gene mutations and phenotypic expression, including descriptions of genetic disorders, associated genes, and references to scientific literature.

NAME: GoldenGate (Illumina)
Description: GoldenGate is a genotyping assay technology developed by Illumina that uses bead-based microarrays to genotype multiple single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) simultaneously. It is known for its accuracy, high throughput, and flexibility in customizing SNP panels for various research purposes.

NAME: TaqMan (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
Description: TaqMan is a technology for quantitative PCR (qPCR) and genotyping assays developed by Thermo Fisher Scientific. It uses fluorescent probes to detect and quantify specific DNA sequences, providing highly accurate and sensitive measurements of gene expression and genetic variants.

NAME: WGSA (Whole Genome Sequencing Analysis) pipelines
Description: WGSA pipelines are comprehensive analysis workflows designed to process and interpret whole genome sequencing (WGS) data. They typically include steps for data quality control, alignment, variant calling, annotation, and interpretation, enabling researchers to derive meaningful insights from WGS datasets.

NAME: ChIP-seq analysis tools
Description: ChIP-seq (Chromatin Immunoprecipitation Sequencing) analysis tools are used to analyze data from experiments that combine chromatin immunoprecipitation with next-generation sequencing. These tools help identify DNA binding sites of transcription factors and other proteins, map histone modifications, and analyze chromatin structure. Common tools include MACS (Model-based Analysis of ChIP-Seq) for peak calling and HOMER (Hypergeometric Optimization of Motif EnRichment) for motif discovery.

NAME: ClinVar
Description: ClinVar is a freely accessible database maintained by the National Center for Biotechnology Information (NCBI) that aggregates information about genomic variations and their relationship to human health. It provides clinical annotations, including pathogenicity, clinical significance, and supporting evidence for various genetic variants.

NAME: gnoMAD (Genome Aggregation Database)
Description: gnomAD is a resource that aggregates and harmonizes exome and genome sequencing data from a wide range of large-scale sequencing projects. It provides allele frequencies for millions of genetic variants across diverse populations, helping researchers understand genetic diversity and identify rare variants associated with diseases.

NAME: UCSC Genome Browser
Description: The UCSC Genome Browser is an online tool for visualizing and analyzing genomic data. It provides a graphical interface to browse various genomes, access integrated annotations, and retrieve sequence data. Users can explore gene structures, regulatory elements, comparative genomics, and much more.

NAME: Ensembl Genome Browser
Description: The Ensembl Genome Browser is a platform for accessing and visualizing genomic data for various species. It provides comprehensive annotations, including gene models, variation data, comparative genomics, and regulatory features. Ensembl supports integration with various external data sources and tools, facilitating in-depth genomicÂ research.

NAME: PLINK
Description: PLINK is a widely used open-source software tool for genome-wide association studies (GWAS) and population-based linkage analysis. It provides functions for data management, statistical analysis of genotype/phenotype data, and the calculation of various genetic metrics, such as linkage disequilibrium, haplotype blocks, and principal components.

NAME: GCTA (Genome-wide Complex Trait Analysis)
Description: GCTA is a software tool for analyzing the genetic architecture of complex traits. It can estimate the proportion of phenotypic variance explained by genome-wide SNPs, perform genomic prediction, and conduct GWAS meta-analysis. GCTA is designed to handle large-scale genetic data and to study the genetic basis of complex traits.

NAME: MACH (MACH Admixture and Coalescence Hidden Markov model
Description: MACH is a software tool for haplotype estimation and genotype imputation. It uses a Hidden Markov Model (HMM) to infer missing genotypes and phase haplotypes based on known haplotype reference panels. MACH is commonly used in genetic studies to improve the accuracy of genotype data.

NAME: Impute2
Description: Impute2 is a genotype imputation software tool that uses reference haplotype panels to infer missing genotypes in genome-wide association studies (GWAS). It employs a hidden Markov model to predict genotypes, increasing the power of GWAS by providing a more complete and accurate dataset.

NAME: Illumina Infinium Global Screening Array
Description: The Illumina Infinium Global Screening Array is a high-density SNP genotyping array designed for population genomics and genetic research. It includes a diverse set of markers optimized for genetic diversity studies, clinical research, and pharmacogenomics applications.

NAME: Axiom Genotyping Solution (Thermo Fisher Scientific)
Description: The Axiom Genotyping Solution is a high-throughput genotyping platform offered by Thermo Fisher Scientific. It includes customizable microarrays for SNP and indel genotyping, enabling researchers to study genetic variation in various populations and species.

NAME: UK Biobank
Description: The UK Biobank is a large-scale biomedical database and research resource containing genetic, health, and lifestyle information from half a million UK participants. It provides extensive data for studying the determinants of complex diseases and traits, facilitating research in genetics, epidemiology, and public health.

NAME: STITCH (Systematic Tool for Interactions between Chemicals and Targets)
Description: STITCH is a database and tool for exploring interactions between chemicals and proteins. It integrates information from multiple sources to predict and visualize potential interactions, aiding in the study of drug mechanisms, toxicology, and chemical biology.

NAME: GWAS Catalog
Description: The GWAS Catalog is a publicly accessible database of published genome-wide association studies (GWAS). It curates and provides information on SNP-trait associations from numerous studies, enabling researchers to explore genetic variants linked to various traits and diseases.

NAME: NHGRI GWAS Catalog
Description: The NHGRI GWAS Catalog, maintained by the National Human Genome Research Institute (NHGRI), is a comprehensive resource that collects and curates data from GWAS studies. It includes information on SNP-trait associations, study details, and relevant publications

NAME: FRAPPE (Fast Random Association with Partner Pool Estimation)
Description: FRAPPE is a software tool for estimating individual ancestry proportions from genotype data. It uses a model-based approach similar to ADMIXTURE and STRUCTURE, providing fast and accurate ancestry inference for population genetics studies.

NAME: SAIGE (Sequence Association and Interaction Gene Set Enrichment)
Description: SAIGE is a statistical tool for genetic association studies, particularly designed to handle unbalanced case-control data and large sample sizes. It uses mixed models to account for relatedness and population structure, improving the power and accuracy of rare variant association tests.

NAME: WASP (Whole Genome Annotation System for Personalized Medicine)
Description: WASP is a comprehensive system for annotating and interpreting whole-genome sequencing data. It integrates various annotation tools and databases to provide functional insights into genetic variants, supporting personalized medicine and clinical genomics.

NAME: FUMA (Functional Mapping and Annotation of Genome-Wide Association Studies)
Description: FUMA is an online platform for annotating, prioritizing, and interpreting GWAS results. It integrates various functional annotation databases and tools to provide insights into the biological mechanisms underlying genetic associations and to prioritize candidate genes and variants for further study.

NAME: LDlink (Linkage Disequilibrium analysis)
Description: LDlink is a suite of web-based tools for exploring linkage disequilibrium (LD) and related genomic features. It provides interactive visualization and analysis of LD patterns, haplotype structures, and variant annotations using data from large population studies like 1000 Genomes.

NAME: POSSEQ (Polygenic Scores for Sequencing Data)
Description: POSSEQ is a tool for calculating polygenic risk scores (PRS) from sequencing data. It aggregates the effects of multiple genetic variants to estimate an individual's genetic predisposition to certain traits or diseases, aiding in the study of complex genetic architectures.

NAME: REVEL (Rare Variant Explanatory Lever)
Description: REVEL is a computational tool for predicting the pathogenicity of rare missense variants. It integrates scores from multiple prediction tools and databases to provide a consensus assessment, helping researchers and clinicians prioritize variants for further study and potential clinicalÂ relevance.
